News.Title: Indian Oil Q3 Net Profit Surges 59% to ₹121B
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation reported Q3 standalone net profit of ₹121 billion, marking a significant 59% quarter-on-quarter increase from ₹76.1 billion and exceeding analyst estimates of ₹98.8 billion.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corp schedules Q3FY26 earnings call
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited has scheduled a conference call on February 6, 2026 at 11:30 AM IST to discuss Q3FY26 financial results, hosted by Antique Stock Broking with senior management participation.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation announces retirement of 6 executives
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited disclosed the superannuation of six senior management personnel effective January 31, 2026, including executive directors from marketing, operations, and refinery divisions.

News.Title: Indian Oil Signs SAF Supply LOI with Akasa Air
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation signed a Letter of Intent with Akasa Air at Wings India 2026 to explore future supply of Sustainable Aviation Fuel, supporting the airline's sustainability goals and aviation sector's net-zero transition.

News.Title: IOC Forecasts Growth in India's Fuel Demand by 2030
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation executive projects diesel demand to grow 2-3% and gasoline demand to increase 5-6% by 2030, indicating continued expansion in India's fuel consumption patterns.

News.Title: IOC Plans Major Diesel Export Push from 2027
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation executive outlines ambitious strategy to expand bunkering operations and export 4-5 million tons of diesel annually starting 2027, marking significant growth in maritime fuel business.

News.Title: IOCL Plans Major Revenue Diversification by 2030
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation targets 20-30% revenue from non-fuel segments by 2030, focusing on gas, petrochemicals, and lubricants. Q2FY26 shows strong turnaround with profit of Rs. 8,191 crore vs loss of Rs. 449 crore YoY.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation shares decline 2.05%
News.Summary: IOC shares fell to ₹155.79 amid mixed quarterly performance. Company reported Q2 FY26 revenue of ₹178,628 crores with net profit of ₹7,479 crores, while annual profits dropped significantly from previous year.

News.Title: Indian Oil Board Meet on Feb 5 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation has scheduled its board meeting for February 5, 2026, to consider and approve Q3FY26 unaudited financial results. Trading window remains closed until February 7, 2026.

News.Title: Indian Oil discovers unconventional oil in Abu Dhabi
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation confirms unconventional oil discovery in Abu Dhabi's Onshore Block 1 through joint venture UBPL. Two wells show light crude oil production from Shilaif and Habshan formations.

News.Title: Indian Oil Makes Oil Discoveries in Abu Dhabi Block
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat PetroResources discover oil in two exploratory wells in Abu Dhabi's Onshore Block 1, marking significant achievements in unconventional Shilaif play and Habshan reservoir.

News.Title: Indian Oil Promotes 19 Officials to Senior Management
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited announces the promotion of 19 officials to Executive Director positions across various divisions including Corporate Office, Refineries HQ, and Marketing Head Office.

News.Title: IndianOil Executive Director Moves to CPCL Board
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation's Executive Director (Petrochemicals) S G Venkatesh ceased to be Senior Management Personnel on January 5, 2026, following his appointment as Director (Technical) at subsidiary CPCL.

News.Title: Indian Oil Raises Commercial LPG Price by ₹111.50
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation increased 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder prices by ₹111.50 effective January 1, 2026, with Delhi rates rising to ₹1,691.50, impacting restaurant and hotel operating margins.

News.Title: India crosses 1 lakh petrol pumps milestone
News.Summary: India achieves 1,00,266 petrol pumps by November 2024, doubling from 50,451 in 2015. State-owned firms dominate with 90% market share, making India world's third-largest network after US and China.

News.Title: IOC Sets Dec 18 Record Date for ₹5 Interim Dividend
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation fixes December 18, 2025 as record date for ₹5 interim dividend payment, with distribution scheduled by January 11, 2026 for eligible shareholders.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Senior Executive Director-Finance Retires
News.Summary: Shri Subrata Chaudhuri, Executive Director-Finance at Refineries Headquarters of Indian Oil Corporation Limited, superannuated from the company's services on November 30, 2025. The retirement represents a senior management change at one level below the Board of Directors at India's state-owned oil refining company.

News.Title: IOC Schedules Board Meeting to Discuss Interim Dividend for FY2025-26
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) will hold a board meeting on December 12 to deliberate on declaring an interim dividend for the financial year 2025-2026. The decision will impact IOC shareholders who may receive dividend payments if the board approves the proposal.

News.Title: Indian Oil Seeks 24 Million Barrels from Americas Amid Russian Oil Sanctions
News.Summary: Indian Oil has invited bids for 24 million barrels of oil from the Americas for the January-March quarter in 2026. The move comes as Indian refiners paused new orders for Russian oil following US sanctions on Moscow's top two producers, with some turning to spot markets for alternatives. Indian Oil is gauging market interest in case it needs to buy oil from the Americas. India became the biggest importer of seaborne Russian crude after Moscow's 2022 Ukraine invasion. Four Russian oil companies have been sanctioned, but the largest supplier to India, Rosneft, handles around 45% of flows as an aggregator rather than a producer. Officials noted that crude aggregation from Russian fields can be carried out by other non-sanctioned entities, potentially allowing supplies to continue.

News.Title: Indian Oil Shares Hit 52-Week High After Strong Quarterly Profit Recovery
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation shares surged 4% to Rs 160.60, reaching a 52-week high following strong quarterly results. The company reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 7,817.55 crore, reversing a loss of Rs 169.58 crore from the previous year and marking a 15% increase from the previous quarter. Total income rose 4% year-on-year to Rs 2.07 lakh crore. The refiner achieved an integrated margin of $12.6 per barrel, a two-year high, while marketing volumes grew 5% year-on-year, outpacing industry growth of 2%. Russian crude intake declined to 19% from 24% in the previous quarter. Morgan Stanley maintained a target price of Rs 168, while JM Financial issued a 'Reduce' rating with a Rs 145 target, citing concerns over standalone gross debt rising by Rs 67 billion to Rs 1.28 trillion. The company will begin recognizing Rs 144.9 billion in government compensation for LPG under-recoveries from November 2025.

News.Title: IOC Plans Joint Venture with Vitol for Oil Trading Operations
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) announced plans to establish a joint venture with Vitol for oil trading activities. The partnership will focus on oil trading operations between the two companies.

News.Title: Indian Oil Q2 Results Miss Estimates Despite Strong Growth in Earnings
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation reported quarterly Ebitda of Rs 146 billion, marking a 286.6% year-on-year increase and 15.7% quarter-on-quarter growth. The company's adjusted profit after tax reached Rs 76 billion, representing a 41.2x year-on-year surge and 33.8% quarter-on-quarter improvement. Despite the substantial growth figures, the results fell short of HDFC Securities' estimates due to refining margins and marketing volumes coming in lower than expected.

News.Title: IOC Outlines Expansion Plans with INR 33,494 Crores CAPEX for FY25-26
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) announced its strategic expansion plans during a conference call. The company expects utilization rates for new refinery expansions to reach 60% in the first year and over 80% in the second year, with faster growth anticipated due to brownfield projects. For petrochemical ventures, IOC targets an 11% project internal rate of return (IRR) with a structured ramp-up plan: 60% capacity utilization in year one, 80% in year two, and full capacity by year three. The company has set its capital expenditure expectations at INR 33,494 crores for FY25-26, with total annual CAPEX including joint ventures and subsidiaries estimated between INR 30,000-40,000 crores.

News.Title: IOC Plans ₹20,000 Crore Clean Energy Investment, Expects Growth in H2
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) announced plans to invest ₹20,000 crores in clean energy initiatives this fiscal year. The company expects to receive ₹14,400 crores in LPG compensations starting November. IOC anticipates notable growth in performance for Q3 and Q4 periods.

News.Title: IOC Sets Ambitious Revenue Target of ₹8.5-9 Lakh Crore by FY27 with Major Capex Plan
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has announced revenue targets of ₹8.5-9 lakh crore and EBITDA targets of ₹32-35 thousand crore by FY27. The company plans to invest ₹1.1 lakh crore in capital expenditure to support these goals. The investment will focus on refinery upgrades, doubling petrochemical capacity, and expanding green hydrogen operations.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Schedules Analyst Meet for Q2 FY 2025-26 Results
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited has announced an Analyst or Institutional Investor Meet scheduled for August 28, 2025, to present Q2 FY 2025-26 results. The company's presentation includes standalone financial and operational highlights. Key operational metrics show refinery throughput of 18.7 MMT with 108.3% capacity utilization and distillate yield of 79.3%. Pipeline operations recorded throughput with 73.5% capacity utilization compared to 66.7% in the previous period. The company's historical financial performance shows revenue from operations of INR 9,34,953 crores in FY 25, with total equity of INR 1,78,677 crores. EBITDA reached INR 47,568 crores in FY 25, while net profit was INR 38,060 crores. The presentation also highlights the company's diversified product portfolio including petroleum products, petrochemicals, and various branded offerings across fuel, lubricants, and energy solutions.

News.Title: IOC Reduces Russian Oil Processing to 19% in September Quarter, Seeks Clear Import Guidance
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) processed 19% Russian oil in the September quarter, down from 24% in the June quarter. An IOC executive stated the company seeks clear guidance on Russian oil imports and will purchase crude based on best returns. The executive indicated IOC may consider buying U.S. oil if profitability conditions are favorable.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Appoints Four Statutory Auditors for 2025-26
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation's Board noted the appointment of statutory auditors for 2025-26 made by the Office of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India. The appointed firms are K G Somani & Co. LLP (New Delhi), Khandelwal Jain & Co. (Mumbai), Komandoor & Co. LLP (Kolkata), and MKPS & Associates (Kolkata) as a reappointment. The Board meeting was held on October 27, 2025, commencing at 1:15 PM and concluding at 3:45 PM. All four firms are established chartered accountancy practices with extensive experience in statutory audits, regulatory compliance, and services across various sectors including public sector undertakings and listed companies.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Reports Strong Q2 Performance with 7,610 Crore Net Profit
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited reported a net profit of ₹7,610.45 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to ₹180.01 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations reached ₹2,02,992.34 crore versus ₹1,95,148.94 crore in the previous year. For the six-month period, net profit stood at ₹13,299.05 crore against ₹2,823.19 crore last year. The company's average gross refining margin improved to $6.32 per barrel for April-September 2025 from $4.08 per barrel in the corresponding period of 2024. Basic earnings per share increased to ₹5.53 for the quarter from ₹0.13 in the previous year. The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas has conveyed compensation of ₹14,486 crore towards LPG under-recoveries, to be disbursed in 12 monthly installments starting November 2025.

News.Title: Indian Oil Shares Rise 3% Ahead of Q2 Results on Refining Margin Expectations
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation shares gained nearly 3% ahead of its quarterly results announcement. A CNBC-TV18 poll expects the company's revenue to decline 8% sequentially to ₹1.77 lakh crore, while EBITDA may improve 4% to ₹13,124 crore. Operating profit margins are projected to expand by 90 basis points to 7.4%, and profitability may increase 12% quarter-on-quarter to ₹6,353 crore. The EBITDA improvement is attributed to better refining margins and lower under-recoveries in LPG sales due to higher cylinder prices and lower propane costs. Gross Refining Margins are expected at $6.5 per barrel. The stock is trading at ₹154.33, up 12.6% year-to-date.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Receives Rs 1,102.91 Crore Tax Relief in Income Tax Appeal
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited received relief of Rs 1,102.91 crores in an income tax dispute for Assessment Year 2016-17. The Commissioner of Income-tax (Appeals) partly allowed the company's appeal through an order dated October 23, 2025. The relief covers disputed tax and interest that was originally Rs 1,194.07 crores. However, a balance disputed tax amount of Rs 91.16 crores remains, which the company will contest before the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal. The dispute involved various disallowances in the assessment order and was previously disclosed by the company in August 2023.

News.Title: IndianOil Corporation Schedules Q2 FY 2025-26 Earnings Conference Call for October 28
News.Summary: IndianOil Corporation Limited has announced a conference call scheduled for October 28, 2025, at 2:00 PM IST to discuss the company's financial performance for Q2 FY 2025-26 with analysts. The call will be hosted by Antique Stock Broking Limited and will feature key management representatives including Mr. Anuj Jain (Director Finance), Mr. Nitin Kumar (CGM I/C Corporate Finance & Treasury), Mr. Pramod Jain (CGM Treasury), and Mr. Prabhat Himatsingka (CGM Finance & Treasury). The company has provided dial-in details for domestic and international participants across multiple countries.

News.Title: IOC Negotiating to Acquire 50% Stake in Fourth Partner Energy
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) is in negotiations to acquire a 50% stake in Fourth Partner Energy. The discussions are ongoing as IOC looks to expand its presence in the renewable energy sector through this potential partnership.

News.Title: S&P Assigns 'BBB' Rating to IOC with Stable Outlook
News.Summary: S&P has assigned a 'BBB' credit rating to Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) with a stable outlook. The BBB rating indicates investment-grade credit quality, suggesting the company has adequate capacity to meet its financial commitments.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Appoints Saumitra Priya Srivastava as Director (Marketing)
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited appointed Shri Saumitra Priya Srivastava as Director (Marketing) effective October 3, 2025, following a directive from the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas. Srivastava is a Civil Engineer from IIT Roorkee and holds an MBA from SP Jain Institute of Management & Research, Mumbai, with over three decades of experience in the Oil and Gas industry. He previously led the Corporate Strategy Group and played a key role in the rollout of SPRINT, a company-wide transformation programme launched in April 2025. He has been instrumental in driving transformative projects including the Non-Fuel Convenience Store initiative and the Dhruva - Retail Transformation Project. Srivastava currently holds directorships in IndianOil (Mauritius) Limited as Non-Executive Chairman, IndianOil Petronas Private Limited as Non-Executive Chairman, and Lanka IOC Plc, SriLanka as Non-Executive Director.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Presents Strategic Transformation Plan 'SPRINT' at Investor Meet
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation held an analyst/investor meet on September 26, 2025, presenting its strategic transformation initiative called 'SPRINT'. The company reported revenue of ₹8.5 trillion and operates over 40,000 retail outlets with 81 MMT refining capacity. SPRINT focuses on six key areas: Strengthening core businesses, Propelling cost optimization, Reinforcing customer centricity, Integrating technology and innovation, Nurturing leadership and talent, and Transition readiness. The company aims to maintain its position as India's largest refining player while expanding into petrochemicals, green energy, and new business segments. Early results show 50% more retail outlets commissioned with higher share of Class A & D1 outlets, 5% energy efficiency improvement in refineries, and 8% growth in auto lubes driving 5% market share gain. The initiative launched on April 1, 2025, with a dedicated secretariat for implementation.

News.Title: DGTR Imposes Anti-Dumping Duties on MEG Imports from Three Countries
News.Summary: The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has imposed anti-dumping duties on Monoethylene Glycol (MEG) imports from Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Singapore. This trade remedy measure affects MEG imports originating from these three countries.

News.Title: Ministry Approves Additional Charge for IRCTC Director Catering Services
News.Summary: The Ministry has approved an additional charge for the Director Catering Services position at Indian Railway Catering And Tourism Corporation.

News.Title: Indian Oil Plans 25% Refining Capacity Expansion
News.Summary: Indian Oil announced plans to increase its refining capacity by 25% in the coming year. The expansion represents a significant boost to the company's oil processing capabilities.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Schedules Analyst Meet for June 3, 2025, Releases Investor Handout
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited has scheduled an Analyst or Institutional Investor Meet for June 3, 2025, and released an investor handout for the event. The company operates as India's largest refiner with 11 refineries and 80.8 MMTPA capacity, maintaining the highest market share with over 63,000 touchpoints and the largest pipeline infrastructure in downstream operations. IOCL has 40,221 retail outlets, 12,919 distributorships, and 5,935 bulk consumer pumps. The government of India holds 77% shareholding in this Maharatna PSU. The company has filed 1,809 patents and was granted 129 patents in 2024-25. IOCL is expanding into renewable energy with 365.72 million units of power generated in 2024-25, battery swapping stations, green hydrogen projects, and biofuel initiatives. Major ongoing projects include Panipat Refinery expansion from 15 MMTPA to 25 MMTPA and Gujarat Refinery integration. The company has planned capital investments of approximately $3.37 billion for major projects in 2025-26.

News.Title: IOC Plans Rs 1.66 Lakh Crore Investment Over Five Years for Business Expansion
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation announced plans to invest Rs 1.66 lakh crore over the next five years to expand operations across oil refining, fuel marketing, petrochemicals, natural gas, and renewable energy. The company will increase crude oil refining capacity from 80.75 million tonnes per annum to 98.4 million tonnes by 2028 through expansions at Panipat, Gujarat, and Barauni facilities. IOC is expanding its pipeline network to 22,000 km with 21 projects under execution, including extensions and new storage facilities in Nepal. The petrochemicals capacity will grow from 4.3 million tonnes per annum to over 13 million tonnes by 2030, focusing on specialty chemicals. The company will add EV chargers, battery-swapping stations, and CNG/LNG dispensing outlets to its 40,000-plus fuel retail network. IOC is separately investing Rs 2.5 lakh crore in energy transition initiatives to achieve net zero operational emissions by 2046, including green hydrogen production and expanding renewable electricity portfolio from 1 GW to 18 GW within three years. The company achieved sales volumes crossing 100 million tonnes and operates over 40,000 fuel stations serving 3.2 crore customers daily.

News.Title: IOC to Become ADNOC's Largest LNG Buyer with 2.2 MTPA Offtake from 2029
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) will become ADNOC's biggest liquefied natural gas buyer starting in 2029. The partnership will involve IOC taking a total offtake of 2.2 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) of LNG from the UAE-based energy company.

News.Title: IOC and Air India Form Partnership for Sustainable Aviation Fuel Supply
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) and Air India have entered into a partnership agreement for the supply of sustainable aviation fuel. The collaboration aims to support sustainable aviation fuel initiatives between the two companies.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corp Plans 340 Billion Rupees Capital Expenditure for FY26
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corp announced plans for capital expenditure of 340 billion rupees in FY26. The company also stated it will continue purchasing Russian oil based on economic considerations.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corp Executive Forecasts Ennore LNG Terminal to Operate at 31-32% Capacity
News.Summary: An executive from Indian Oil Corp has predicted that the Ennore LNG terminal will operate at 31-32% capacity. The forecast indicates the terminal will run significantly below its full operational potential.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corp Reports 24% of Oil Processing from Russia in June Quarter
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corp processed 24% of its oil from Russia during the June quarter. The company's executive reported that Russian oil was available at discounts of around USD 1.5 per barrel compared to benchmark prices.

News.Title: India Maintains Russian Oil Imports Despite US Tariff Threats, Says IOC Chairman
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Chairman AS Sahney confirmed India continues purchasing Russian oil based on economic considerations, with no pause in imports despite US President Donald Trump's additional 25% tariff threat on Indian imports. Russian oil comprised 22-23% of IOC's crude processing in the April-June period and 34% of BPCL's intake. Import volumes fluctuate based on discount levels, which narrowed from $40 per barrel to $1.5 recently before widening to $2.70. India became Russia's largest oil customer from 2022 after Western sanctions created discounted pricing opportunities. Russian crude now meets 30% of India's oil requirements, up from less than 1% before February 2022. Both IOC and BPCL officials stated they received no government instructions to alter purchase volumes and will continue buying unless sanctions are imposed on Russian crude.

News.Title: Indian Oil Net Profit More Than Doubles to Rs 5,689 Crore on Strong Marketing Margins
News.Summary: Indian Oil reported net profit of Rs 5,689 crore in the June quarter, more than doubling from Rs 2,643 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations grew 1% to Rs 218,608 crore. The profit increase was driven by higher refining and marketing margins, partially offset by inventory losses of Rs 6,465 crore compared to an inventory gain of Rs 3,345 crore last year. The company's gross refining margin stood at $2.15 per barrel versus $6.39 per barrel in the previous year, but after adjusting for inventory effects, the margin improved to $6.91 from $2.84. Indian Oil achieved record quarterly sales volume of 26.32 million metric tonnes, up from 25.25 million metric tonnes last year. Domestic petroleum sales volume increased 4.2% and institutional diesel sales jumped 40.3%. The company maintained 107% average capacity utilization at its refineries. Under-recovery on cooking gas sales was Rs 3,858 crore compared to Rs 4,294 crore previously. Shares closed 1.58% lower at Rs 140.15.

News.Title: Indian Oil Corporation Schedules Analyst Meet for August 18, 2025, Releases Q1 FY2026 Results
News.Summary: Indian Oil Corporation Limited has scheduled an Analyst or Institutional Investor Meet for August 18, 2025, and released its presentation covering quarterly results. The company reported a Profit Before Tax of Rs 8,787 crores and Profit After Tax of Rs 7,265 crores for the quarter. EBITDA contribution stood at Rs 14,746 crores. Operationally, refinery throughput was 18.7 MMT with capacity utilization at 107.1% and distillate yield of 79.7%. Pipeline operations achieved throughput of 26.3 MMT with 73.5% capacity utilization. In marketing operations, inland petroleum product sales totaled 21.867 MMT, with HSD contributing 9.320 MMT and MS contributing 3.869 MMT. The company's historical performance shows turnover of Rs 9,34,953 crores and net worth of Rs 1,78,677 crores for FY25.

News.Title: IOC Reports Mixed Q1 Results with Revenue Growth but Declining Profitability
News.Summary: IOC reported quarterly revenue of 2.18 trillion rupees, showing a slight increase from the previous quarter's 2.17 trillion rupees. However, the company's standalone net profit declined to 57 billion rupees from 72.6 billion rupees in the previous quarter. EBITDA also decreased to 126 billion rupees from 136 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 5.8% from 6.23% quarter-on-quarter.
